analytic.title: Arab-Christian Theologies in Dialogue: Comparative Analysis of the Doctrines of the Melkite Sa‘īd Ibn Baṭrīq, the Copt Sawīrus Ibn al-Muqaffa‘, and the Nestorian Elias of Nisibis

monogr.title: Contested Coexistence: Insights on Arabic Christianity from Theology to Migration. Proceedings from the Summer School “Arabic Christianity: History, Culture, Language, Theology, Liturgy” (Münster, July 18–August 12, 2016)

body.bibl: Ebeid, Bishara. “Arab-Christian Theologies in Dialogue: Comparative Analysis of the Doctrines of the Melkite Sa‘īd Ibn Baṭrīq, the Copt Sawīrus Ibn al-Muqaffa‘, and the Nestorian Elias of Nisibis.” In Contested Coexistence: Insights on Arabic Christianity from Theology to Migration. Proceedings from the Summer School “Arabic Christianity: History, Culture, Language, Theology, Liturgy” (Münster, July 18–August 12, 2016), edited by Octavian Mihoc and Ryann Elizabeth Craig, 63–90. Göttinger Orientforschungen, I. Reihe: Syriaca 59. Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, 2020.

Bishara Ebeid, Arab-Christian Theologies in Dialogue: Comparative Analysis of the Doctrines of the Melkite Sa‘īd Ibn Baṭrīq, the Copt Sawīrus Ibn al-Muqaffa‘, and the Nestorian Elias of Nisibis, in Contested Coexistence: Insights on Arabic Christianity from Theology to Migration. Proceedings from the Summer School “Arabic Christianity: History, Culture, Language, Theology, Liturgy (Münster, July 18–August 12, 2016), ed. Octavian Mihoc and Ryann Elizabeth Craig, Göttinger Orientforschungen, I. Reihe: Syriaca 59 (Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, 2020), 63–90.
